title: Help identify this font
content:
Can you please tell me what font this is?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130806044513im_/http:/typophile.com/files/identfy%20font%20sample_3580.jpg)
author: gustbiz

comments.content:
I am new here and this is my first post, but even I know that you shouldn't ask for ID requests in this forum.

It should be done in the dedicated Type ID Board:  
 [http://typophile.com/typeid](http://web.archive.org/web/20130806044513/http:/typophile.com/typeid "http://typophile.com/typeid")

-Inferno986return-

It's [Robert E. Smith's Park Avenue (1933)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130806044513/http:/www.fonts.com/font/linotype/park-avenue-script/park-avenue).

Please don't take this as "oh so it's alright to ask type id's here after all". There is an entire section of this forum dedicated to it, as described above.

In fact, if you look at the "General Forums" description on the home page, it says

> All topics are welcome **—except font ID requests.**

...though not in boldface. Do we really need bold?

Chris, how about some printer's fists!
That Gustbiz is a bad-arse rebel. Ain't no doubt about that.

Poor unsuspecting gustbiz may have landed inside this particular forum by just googling "type id".

Oh wait .. top hit for that exact phrase (ignoring the false positive the "typeid" C++) is .. "Type ID Board | Typophile", Well, then I don't know.
